main

Class ClackClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.ClackClient

  • public class ClackClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class represents a client user. This class has four constructors, you can pass in a username, hostname and port number. You can also passed a few combinations of those data points, where you remove the right most piece of data. (username,hostname,port) to (username,hostname) to etc. This class contains the following methods: start, readClientData, sendData, printData, getUserName, getHostName, getPort, hashCode, equals, and toString

      An Integer for the client port number

      A boolean to tell whether the connection is closed
      private ClackClientGUI gui
      An instance variable that allows for receiving data packets

      A String for the client username
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream inFromServer
      An instance variable that allows for sending data packets

      A ClackData Object for the data being received from the server
      private static java.lang.String KEY
      A Scanner object represents the standard input stream
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream outToServer
      A constant String that stores the encryption / decryption key
      private int port
      A String for the client hostname
      private java.lang.String userName 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClackClient()
      Constructs a ClackClient object with the username being initialized to anonymous.
      ClackClient(java.lang.String userName)
      Constructs a ClackClient object with the username being initialized by another section of this and the hostname being initialized to localhost.
      ClackClient(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName)
      Constructs a ClackClient object with the username and hostname being initialized by another section of this program and the port being initialized to 7000.
      ClackClient(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName, int port)
      Constructs a ClackClient object with the username, hostname, and port being initialized by another section of this program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient(java.lang.String userName,
                   java.lang.String hostName,
                   int port)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a ClackClient object with the username, hostname, and port being initialized by another section of this program. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the userName or hostName is null or if the port is less than 1024
        Parameters:
        userName - A String for the clients username
        hostName - A String for the Clients hostname
        port - An Integer for the clients port number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient(java.lang.String userName,
                   java.lang.String hostName)
        Constructs a ClackClient object with the username and hostname being initialized by another section of this program and the port being initialized to 7000.
        Parameters:
        userName - A String for the clients username
        hostName - A String for the Clients hostname

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient(java.lang.String userName)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a ClackClient object with the username being initialized by another section of this and the hostname being initialized to localhost. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the userName is null
        Parameters:
        username - A String for the clients username
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient()
        Constructs a ClackClient object with the username being initialized to anonymous.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method starts the connection to the ClackServer Opens a new Socket that connects to the server at the port number stored as an instance variable in the client object. It gets the output and input streams for the client-server connection from the socket, and wraps them in ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream constructors to create new objects assigned to 'outToServer' and 'inFromServer'

      • readClientData

        public void readClientData(java.lang.String nextToken)
        This method reads in from the inFromStd scanner and initializes the dataToSendToServer ClackData object related to a Command sent in the beginning of the input stream

      • sendData

        public void sendData()
        Writes out the ClackData object in 'dataToSendToServer' to the ObjectOutputStream 'outToServer'.

      • receiveData

        public void receiveData()
        Reads in a ClackData object from ObjectInputStream 'inFromServer' into 'dataToReceiveFromServer

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method that will create a client object and start the connection to the server. Must be called with one or none argument(s) that take any of the following forms: Username Username@HostName or UserName@HostName:PortNumber
        Parameters:
        args -
